alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Beaver; Butler (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 6:00AM EDT until July 17 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest, west central, and western Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in southwest Pennsylvania, Allegheny. In west central Pennsylvania, Butler. In western Pennsylvania, Beaver. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 559 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the county. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburgh, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Monaca, Shaler Township, North Side Pittsburgh, Scott Township, Robinson Township, Economy, Bellevue, Carnegie, Kennedy Township, Ambridge, Wexford, West View and Stowe Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
